channel.title: Can you edit&test your server w/ it offline?
channel.description:
I'm just wondering if their is a way to edit a server and test your changes with the server still being offline. I imagine the answer is a no though...
i need to do this because i cannot get a server just plain to run after many hours of trying (DAMN YOU WINDOWS VISTA!) but i think if i can build&edit&test it while its offline i will be able to get it running on vista by the time i think its complete

item.title: Can you edit&test your server w/ it offline?
item.dc:creator: @x_blitz_x x blitz x
item.description:
@x_blitz_x wrote:

[quote=“SilentCJ, post:14, topic:236944”][quote author=x blitz x link=topic=312798.msg2491918#msg2491918 date=1224185496]

I’m just wondering if their is a way to edit a server and test your changes with the server still being offline. I imagine the answer is a no though…

i need to do this because i cannot get a server just plain to run after many hours of trying (DAMN YOU WINDOWS VISTA!)
but i think if i can build&edit&test it while its offline i will be able to get it running on vista by the time i think its complete

1.) This can be done easily.

2.) Don’t blame windows vista, my mate runs server on windows 98, bro runs on xp, and i run mine on windows vista. So operating system don’t matter.

And, whats the problem, why can’t you get it running?
When you press runserver does it just flash and then close?
Can’t you portforward?

Tell us stuff man, give us details.

Windows 98? L2Upgrade.
[/quote]

Lol, it was mates, he bought for 20 quid off ebay, not bad really, it had xp installed, and he ran server 24/7 :)[/quote]
Lol, £20 for Windows 98. I can get Windows ** (every windows OS) for free.

Read full topic

i need to do this because i cannot get a server just plain to run after many hours of trying (DAMN YOU WINDOWS VISTA!)
but i think if i can build&edit&test it while its offline i will be able to get it running on vista by the time i think its complete

1.) This can be done easily.

2.) Don’t blame windows vista, my mate runs server on windows 98, bro runs on xp, and i run mine on windows vista. So operating system don’t matter.

And, whats the problem, why can’t you get it running?
When you press runserver does it just flash and then close?
Can’t you portforward?

Tell us stuff man, give us details.

item.title: Can you edit&test your server w/ it offline?
item.dc:creator: @nikkohayden nikkohayden
item.description:
@nikkohayden wrote:

[quote=“bigh51, post:11, topic:236944”][quote author=nikkohayden link=topic=312798.msg2491738#msg2491738 date=1224173075]
I’m just wondering if their is a way to edit a server and test your changes with the server still being offline. I imagine the answer is a no though…

i need to do this because i cannot get a server just plain to run after many hours of trying (DAMN YOU WINDOWS VISTA!)
but i think if i can build&edit&test it while its offline i will be able to get it running on vista by the time i think its complete
[/quote]The problem isn’t vista, it’s the idiot users that think it sucks just because it’s not exactly the same as windows xp. It’s close enough to xp, and it’s even better than xp. Next time, don’t blame the operating system, blame yourself.[/quote]

i still blame vista because it is hard to navigate through vista on all XP tutorials, everything is renamed, moved etc- so i cannot completely tell if i missed something

You can do, but you can just leave it blank.

And make sure your runserver is running![/quote]
